title: Hey Rito, what's up with this?
body:
So I went to play a game, two people on our team connect late, and one person on the opposing team never connects resulting in a remake. I queue up again. Loading into game: 700 ping. I load into the game in a normal amount of time and I still have 700 ping. So I decide to restart my router because there is no way on earth I am about to play a game with 700-800 ping the whole time (I usually have about 50). When I reopen the game, I have been punished with 20 minute queue times for 5 games. Now, this is fine and all until I realize that (1) Nothing but league was having issues with connection, and (2) there was 3 people having connection issues the game before the one I disconnected in. Also, when I was logging into the client I couldn't connect to the servers for a while. I refuse to believe all of this is a coincidence, and therefore believe that I have been given a heavy penalty for something that wasn't my or my internet's fault. 

RITO PLZ  {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body:
Restarting your router mid-game is going to disconnect you, which may very well make you end up getting an LPQ if it happens too often. Try not to forcefully disconnect yourself midgame!

As far as the LPQ itself, you're welcome to reach out to us in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to discuss whether or not you deserved it.
